div.p: Found in WRITING , this is one of three big-bucket tags on a par with PRODUCTION and RECEPTION. Most of the same comments apply as on those tags, though TEXTUALFEATURES almost never includes Chronstructs. This element addresses content and features of critical interest in texts and provides space for textual analysis/close readings as perceived by project members. No text is allowed directly within the TEXTUALFEATURES element; another element must be opened first. Several optional elements are available here, marked with an initial “t”; in addition, the elements from the other categories (RECEPTION and PRODUCTION) can be used here when necessary. The optional elements most at home in TEXTUALFEATURES include: TCHARACTERIZATION, TCHARACTERTYPEROLE, TCHARACTERNAME, TGENRE, TEGENREISSUE, TINTERTEXTUALITY, TMOTIF, TPLOT, TSETTINGDATE, TSETTINGPLACE, TTECHNIQUES, TTHEMETOPIC, TTONESTYLE, and TVOICENARRATION.
Stages in the work’s creation, and responses to it, should be recorded in PRODUCTION and RECEPTION, unless the flow of the prose makes it more convenient to treat them (briefly) here.
